fields.headline: Gay Dad
fields.bodyText: One down, one to go. Now that my son Aidan knows I'm gay – or more precisely, now that I know he knows I'm gay – I ponder how best to have the same conversation with Ed. He is younger and a little more introverted than Aidan; whereas the latter wears his heart on his sleeve, his little brother is a tad more cautious. Apparently, they'd debated whether I was gay or not a while back but, according to Aidan, not in much detail. And, as vague as ever, he can't remember what Ed's take on it was. I walk home that afternoon and spot Ed in my ex-wife's kitchen. I knock on the door and he lets me in; his mum has gone to Bikram yoga. "What's up?" I ask. "Nothing much," says Ed. "Except I'm starving and there isn't any food." He's sitting at the table looking at a Domino's Pizza menu. "I had lunch with Aidan earlier; you were still in bed." "Yeah, sorry, I was knackered. I was on my Xbox to really late last night." I can tell. His eyes have that slightly bloodshot, glazed look he gets when he's spent too long staring at hand-propelled skateboarders falling down stairwells. "Please don't spend too long on that. I don't want to have to take it away again." "I know; I won't. Just last night." "Aidan and I had a good talk today… about Simon." "Cool! Can you order me a pizza?"
